channel.title: Verify that the tunnel is well setup
channel.description:
Hello If I have a tunnel like this VPN-->Whonix-->VPN or VPN-->Whonix-->Jondo
How can I verify if (in the first case) exit VPN logs tor traffic and not ip of first VPN or (in the second case) Jondo logs tor ip and not ip of first VPN?
Thank you

item.title: Verify that the tunnel is well setup
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
jamesferkin:

VPN–>Whonix–>VPN or VPN–>Whonix–>Jondo

Please use the same terminology as using in Whonix documentation:

Whonix

Tunnels/Introduction

Instructions on how to combine tunnels (VPN, SSH, proxy) with Tor. (User -> Tor -> proxy/VPN/SSH -> Internet) (User -> proxy/VPN/SSH ->...

Otherwise we easily talk past each other. Then please re-ask your question in this thread.

Read full topic
item.source: Verify that the tunnel is well setup

item.title: Verify that the tunnel is well setup
item.dc:creator: Ego
item.description:
Good day,

As there is no way for traffic not to go through Tor when using Whonix under normal circumstances, there is no way for a VPN/Jondo to log traffic other than Tor traffic. Verifying this is hardly possible if you don’t have control over the VPN your traffic exits.

Have a nice day,

Ego

Read full topic
